intro: Corynandra viscosa subsp. nagarjunakondensis, commonly known as the Nagarjunakonda corynandra, is a shrub native to the southern regions of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
